President Sirleaf began her career in the Treasury Department in Liberia in 1965.
In 1979, she rose to the position of Minister of Finance and introduced measures to curb the mismanagement of government finances.

After the 1980 military coup d’état, she became president of the Liberian Bank for Development and Investment, but fled Liberia that same year, escaping an increasingly suppressive military government.
she resigned to contest the 1997 presidential elections.
